[Continue reading “Now Available – A Guide: Migrating to Fabric Data Warehouse”](https://blog.fabric.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/migrating-to-fabric-data-warehouse-guide-now-available/)
Author: Microsoft Fabric Blog
EnhancedContent:
The **Microsoft Fabric Migration Guide** is now live! This comprehensive resource is designed to help you plan and execute your migration to Microsoft Fabric with confidence. Whether you’re just getting started or already deep into your migration journey, this guide provides best practices, tools, and step-by-step instructions to support you every step of the way.

## Explore the guide

[Microsoft Fabric Migration Overview](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/fundamentals/migration)

**Utilize the following resources to plan for migration to Fabric Data Warehouse**

1. [Migration Assistant for Fabric Data Warehouse](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-warehouse/migration-assistant)
2. [Migration Strategy and Planning for ​​Azure Synapse Dedicated SQL Pools to Fabric Migration​](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-warehouse/migration-synapse-dedicated-sql-pool-warehouse)
3. [Migration Methods for ​​Azure Synapse Dedicated SQL Pools to Fabric Migration​](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-warehouse/migration-synapse-dedicated-sql-pool-methods)

**Migrate to a warehouse with these step-by-step instructions.**

1. [How to extract a Data-Tier Application (DAC) from an Azure Synapse Dedicated SQL Pool in Visual Studio 2022](https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-warehouse/extract-data-tier-application-synapse-dedicated-sql-pool)
2. [Step by step guide with the](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric/data-warehouse/migrate-with-migration-assistant)https://learn.microsoft.com/fabric/data-warehouse/migrate-with-migration-assistant[Migration Assistant for Fabric Data Warehouse](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/fabric/data-warehouse/migrate-with-migration-assistant)

As you define the architecture of your data estates, the deployments patterns will help you choose right pattern that serves your needs. Through Administration, Usability, DevOps, Security, Governance, Performance and scale, Billing and cost management

To explore Fabric deployment patterns, refer to the [Deployment Patterns for Microsoft Fabric – Azure Architecture Center](https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/architecture/analytics/architecture/fabric-deployment-patterns) documentation.

## Need Help?

If you’re looking for personalized support, reach out to your **Microsoft account team** to get connected with the **Migration Factory**. Our experts are ready to help you assess, plan, and execute your migration with tailored guidance and tooling. And this support will not cost you anything, you heard it – it is FREE!

## Roadmap

We’re just getting started—Migration Assistant will continue to grow and improve as we refine the experience based on your feedback

Check out these features that are on our roadmap for migration to warehouse:

- Live connectivity to Synapse dedicated SQL pool.
- Support for SQL database project files and SQL files
- Copilot improvements.

### Share Your Ideas!

We’re continuously improving our migration capabilities, and your feedback is invaluable. If there are features or tools you’d like to see, please submit your suggestions on the [**Ideas Portal**](https://community.fabric.microsoft.com/t5/Fabric-Ideas/idb-p/fbc_ideas).

### Join Us at FabCon Vienna!

The [European Microsoft Fabric Community Conference](https://www.sharepointeurope.com/european-microsoft-fabric-community-conference/) (FabCon Europe 2025) is right around the corner we’re excited about the stellar line up of **Fabric Data Warehouse** sessions. This is a great opportunity to learn more about Fabric Data Warehouse and jumpstart your migration journey.

FabCon 2025 will give you the opportunity to:

- Learn best practices for designing and optimizing warehouses.
- Understand emerging capabilities and what’s next on the roadmap.
- Gain confidence in areas like security, monitoring, and external connectivity.
- Network with the Fabric DW product teams, MVPs, and community experts.

Here is your guide to all the Fabric Data Warehouse sessions at FabCon Europe 2025:
